sen.j: 三浦 啓之助（みうら けいのすけ、嘉永元年（1848年） - 明治10年（1877年）2月26日）は、日本の武士・新選組隊士。
sen.e: Keinosuke MIURA (1848 - February 26, 1877) was a Japanese samurai and a member of Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).

sen.e: Keinosuke MIURA (1848 - February 26, 1877) was a Japanese samurai and a member of Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).

sen.j: 幕末期の洋学者・佐久間象山とその妾・お蝶の子で、本名は佐久間恪二郎（さくま かくじろう）。
sen.e: He was a child of Shozan SAKUMA, an Orientalist in the end of Edo period, and his concubine Ocho, and his real name was Kakujiro SAKUMA.
He was a child of Shozan SAKUMA, an scholar of Western studies in the end of Edo period, and his concubine Ocho, and his real name was Kakujiro SAKUMA.

sen.e: He was a child of Shozan SAKUMA, an scholar of Western studies in the end of Edo period, and his concubine Ocho, and his real name was Kakujiro SAKUMA.

sen.j: ちなみに「三浦」は義母・順（勝海舟の妹）の姓である。
sen.e: "Miura" was the family name of his mother-in-law Jun (younger sister of Kaishu KATSU).

sen.j: 元治元年（1864年）に父・象山に随身して入洛するも、同年7月11日に父が暗殺されてしまう。
sen.e: Although he entered into Kyoto attending his father Shozan in 1864, the father was assassinated on August 12 of the year.
Although he entered into Kyoto attending his father Shozan in 1864, the father was assassinated on August 12 of the same year.

sen.j: この時、父の門弟・山本覚馬に仇討ちを勧められ、新選組へ入隊する。
sen.e: At this time, as the father's disciple Kakuma YAMAMOTO suggested revenge, he joined Shinsengumi.
At this time, he joined Shinsengumi because his father's disciple Kakuma YAMAMOTO suggested revenge.

sen.j: 入隊後は局長・近藤勇の側近となり、他の平隊士よりも丁重に扱われたが、次第に父譲りの傲慢さが露わになり、芦谷昇たちと共に粗暴を働くようになる（その為、土方歳三や沖田総司からは終始目を付けられていた）。
sen.e: After joining Shinsengumi, he became a close retainer of Isami KONOD, Head of Shinsengumi, and treated more respectfully than other ordinary members, but the arrogance that he inherited from his father gradually showed up and he started behaving rudely with Noboru ASHIYA etc. (therefore, Toshizo HIJIKATA and Soji OKITA always kept an eye on him).

sen.j: そして、慶応2〜3年頃、芦谷と共に新選組を脱走する（但し、それ以前に土方が松代藩への帰藩を促したことがあるが、三浦自身はこれを拒否している）。
sen.e: Then, he ran away with Ashiya around 1866 - 1867 (Hijikata recommended that he return to Matsushiro domain, but Miura refused it).

sen.j: 明治維新後は恪（いそし）と名を改め、「象山の息子」であることを利用して司法省に出仕するも、警察官と喧嘩を起こし免職となる。
sen.e: After the Meiji restoration, he changed his first name to Isoshi and entered Ministry of Justice utilizing the fact that he was 'the son of Shozan,' but he had a fight against police officers and was dismissed.

sen.j: その後は伊予松山藩裁判所判事として松山に赴任したが、明治10年（1877年）2月26日、食中毒で頓死した。
sen.e: After that, he served as a judge in the Iyo-Matsuyama Domain court, but died suddenly of food intoxication on February 26, 1877.
